Iconography: symbols, attributes, motifs, and their historical meanings.

archival_research.title: Methodology Guide — Archival Research
bullets: Locate institutional finding aids and catalogs (libraries, museums, archives).
Record provenance/metadata; triangulate primary and secondary sources.
Respect rights/permissions for reproductions and citation.

ludology_vs_narratology.title: Academic Debate — Ludology vs Narratology
bullets: Ludology emphasizes rules, systems, and gameplay mechanics as the core object of study.
Narratology emphasizes story, representation, and narrative structures in games.
Contemporary scholarship often integrates both perspectives depending on research questions.

aura_and_reproduction.title: Academic Debate — Aura & Reproduction (Art/Media)
bullets: Debates around originality, reproduction, and the status of the art object in modernity.
Often discussed in visual culture and media theory contexts.

semiotics.title: Theory Origin — Semiotics
bullets: Semiotics studies signs and meaning-making across language, images, and culture.
Used widely in visual culture and media studies to analyze how representations communicate.

aesthetics.title: Theory Origin — Aesthetics
bullets: Aesthetics concerns philosophy of art, beauty, and taste; extends to perception and experience.
Contemporary aesthetics spans art theory, ethics, and political philosophy.

video_games.title: Digital Archive Map — Video Games (Academic/Institutional)
bullets: Library and archive initiatives are key for preservation; prioritize institutional repositories.
